thread.title: OZ Minerals set to beat copper guidance as KKR stalks
thread.title_full: OZ Minerals set to beat copper guidance as KKR stalks

author: Peter Ker
title: OZ Minerals set to beat copper guidance as KKR stalks
text:
OZ Minerals boss Andrew Cole: "We are exceeding the targets that we set earlier this year, but believe we can do even better." Photo: Scott Barbour
Takeover target OZ Minerals has raised its full-year copper production guidance as its flagship Prominent Hill mine continues to enjoy its best performance in five years.
The strong performance has recently lured private equity firm KKR to take a 10 per cent stake in OZ, but there was no mention of KKR in the quarterly report published by the copper miner on Friday.
OZ now expects to produce between 126,000 tonnes and 131,000 tonnes of copper this calendar year. That is much better than the previous guidance, which suggested 120,000 tonnes was the best possible result.
The extra output will lower OZ's cost guidance too, and the strong performance is just rewards for long-term shareholders, who suffered through two years of significant waste movements in 2013 and 2014.
Advertisement OZ chief Andrew Cole made reference to that difficult period in today's results statement.
"Production is higher while the amount of waste being moved is over 40 per cent less than the same period last year," he said.
"We are exceeding the targets that we set earlier this year, but believe we can do even better."
Mr Cole said all parts of the company would aim to reduce costs by 15 per cent during next year to try to secure the company as a "first quartile" copper producer.
OZ shares have given back some of the gains that followed news of KKR's entry onto the register and closed on Thursday at $3.95.
KKR declined to comment when approached by Fairfax Media on Thursday.
Copper was fetching $US2.37 a pound on Friday morning.
